verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Joshua, Fear not, neither be thou dismayed: take all the people of war with thee, and arise, go up to Ai: see, I have given into thy hand the king of Ai, and his people, and his city, and his land:
verses.ct: Then the LORD told Joshua, "Don't be afraid or discouraged. Take your entire fighting force with you and march against Ai. I am handing over to you the king of Ai, along with his people, his city, and his land.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt do to Ai and her king as thou didst unto Jericho and her king: only the spoil thereof, and the cattle thereof, shall ye take for a prey unto yourselves: lay thee an ambush for the city behind it.
verses.ct: "Do to Ai and its king what you did to Jericho and its king, except this time you may keep the plunder and livestock for yourselves. Set up an ambush behind the city."

verses.kjv: So Joshua arose, and all the people of war, to go up against Ai: and Joshua chose out thirty thousand mighty men of valour, and sent them away by night.
verses.ct: So Joshua and all the fighting men prepared to attack Ai. Joshua selected 30,000 of his best warriors and sent them out during the night.

verses.kjv: And he commanded them, saying, Behold, ye shall lie in wait against the city, even behind the city: go not very far from the city, but be ye all ready:
verses.ct: He gave them these orders: "Pay attention — position yourselves in ambush behind the city. Don't go too far from it, and stay ready at all times.

verses.kjv: And I, and all the people that are with me, will approach unto the city: and it shall come to pass, when they come out against us, as at the first, that we will flee before them,
verses.ct: "I will advance toward the city with the rest of the troops. When the enemy comes out to fight us like they did before, we will retreat from them.

verses.kjv: (For they will come out after us) till we have drawn them from the city; for they will say, They flee before us, as at the first: therefore we will flee before them.
verses.ct: "They will chase after us, and we'll draw them away from the city. They'll think, 'They're running from us just like last time.' So we will keep retreating.

verses.kjv: Then ye shall rise up from the ambush, and seize upon the city: for the LORD your God will deliver it into your hand.
verses.ct: "Then you will rush out from your ambush positions and take the city, because the LORD your God will give you victory over it.

verses.kjv: And it shall be, when ye have taken the city, that ye shall set the city on fire: according to the commandment of the LORD shall ye do. See, I have commanded you.
verses.ct: "Once you've captured the city, set it on fire. Follow the LORD's instructions exactly. Those are your orders."

verses.kjv: Joshua therefore sent them forth: and they went to lie in ambush, and abode between Bethel and Ai, on the west side of Ai: but Joshua lodged that night among the people.
verses.ct: Joshua sent them off, and they moved into their ambush positions, staying between Bethel and Ai on the west side of Ai. Joshua spent that night with the main group of soldiers.

verses.kjv: And Joshua rose up early in the morning, and numbered the people, and went up, he and the elders of Israel, before the people to Ai.
verses.ct: Early the next morning, Joshua got up, assembled the troops, and marched toward Ai with the elders of Israel leading the people.

verses.kjv: And all the people, even the people of war that were with him, went up, and drew nigh, and came before the city, and pitched on the north side of Ai: now there was a valley between them and Ai.
verses.ct: All the fighting men who were with him advanced and approached the city. They set up camp on the north side of Ai, with a valley separating them from the city.

verses.kjv: And he took about five thousand men, and set them to lie in ambush between Bethel and Ai, on the west side of the city.
verses.ct: He also positioned about 5,000 men in ambush between Bethel and Ai, on the west side of the city.

verses.kjv: And when they had set the people, even all the host that was on the north of the city, and their liers in wait on the west of the city, Joshua went that night into the midst of the valley.
verses.ct: After the main army was in place north of the city and the ambush force was positioned to the west, Joshua went down into the valley that night.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when the king of Ai saw it, that they hasted and rose up early, and the men of the city went out against Israel to battle, he and all his people, at a time appointed, before the plain; but he wist not that there were liers in ambush against him behind the city.
verses.ct: When the king of Ai saw the Israelites, he and all his men rushed out early in the morning to fight Israel at the designated place overlooking the plain. He had no idea that an ambush force was hiding behind the city.

verses.kjv: And Joshua and all Israel made as if they were beaten before them, and fled by the way of the wilderness.
verses.ct: Joshua and all of Israel pretended to be defeated and retreated toward the wilderness.

verses.kjv: And all the people that were in Ai were called together to pursue after them: and they pursued after Joshua, and were drawn away from the city.
verses.ct: Every soldier in Ai was called out to chase them. They pursued Joshua and were lured away from the city.

verses.kjv: And there was not a man left in Ai or Bethel, that went not out after Israel: and they left the city open, and pursued after Israel.
verses.ct: Not a single man remained in Ai or Bethel — every one of them went out after Israel. They left the city wide open as they chased the Israelites.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Joshua, Stretch out the spear that is in thy hand toward Ai; for I will give it into thine hand. And Joshua stretched out the spear that he had in his hand toward the city.
verses.ct: Then the LORD said to Joshua, "Raise the spear in your hand and point it toward Ai, because I am giving the city to you." So Joshua raised his spear and pointed it toward the city.

verses.kjv: And the ambush arose quickly out of their place, and they ran as soon as he had stretched out his hand: and they entered into the city, and took it, and hasted and set the city on fire.
verses.ct: As soon as he raised his hand, the ambush force jumped up from their positions and rushed forward. They entered the city, captured it, and quickly set it on fire.

verses.kjv: And when the men of Ai looked behind them, they saw, and, behold, the smoke of the city ascended up to heaven, and they had no power to flee this way or that way: and the people that fled to the wilderness turned back upon the pursuers.
verses.ct: When the men of Ai looked back, they saw smoke rising from their city into the heavens. They had nowhere to run in any direction, because the Israelites who had been retreating toward the wilderness now turned around to face their pursuers.

verses.kjv: And when Joshua and all Israel saw that the ambush had taken the city, and that the smoke of the city ascended, then they turned again, and slew the men of Ai.
verses.ct: When Joshua and all of Israel saw that the ambush force had captured the city and that smoke was rising from it, they turned around and attacked the men of Ai.

verses.kjv: And the other issued out of the city against them; so they were in the midst of Israel, some on this side, and some on that side: and they smote them, so that they let none of them remain or escape.
verses.ct: At the same time, the Israelites from the city came out to join the fight. So the men of Ai were trapped in the middle, with Israelites on both sides. They struck them down until no one survived or escaped.

verses.kjv: And the king of Ai they took alive, and brought him to Joshua.
verses.ct: But they captured the king of Ai alive and brought him to Joshua.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Israel had made an end of slaying all the inhabitants of Ai in the field, in the wilderness wherein they chased them, and when they were all fallen on the edge of the sword, until they were consumed, that all the Israelites returned unto Ai, and smote it with the edge of the sword.
verses.ct: After Israel had finished killing all the people of Ai who had chased them into the open fields and wilderness — every last one of them cut down by the sword — the entire Israelite army returned to Ai and put the remaining people to the sword.

verses.kjv: And so it was, that all that fell that day, both of men and women, were twelve thousand, even all the men of Ai.
verses.ct: The total number who died that day, both men and women, was 12,000 — the entire population of Ai.

verses.kjv: For Joshua drew not his hand back, wherewith he stretched out the spear, until he had utterly destroyed all the inhabitants of Ai.
verses.ct: Joshua did not lower his hand holding the outstretched spear until he had completely destroyed all the inhabitants of Ai.

verses.kjv: Only the cattle and the spoil of that city Israel took for a prey unto themselves, according unto the word of the LORD which he commanded Joshua.
verses.ct: However, Israel did keep the livestock and plunder from the city for themselves, just as the LORD had instructed Joshua.

verses.kjv: And Joshua burnt Ai, and made it an heap for ever, even a desolation unto this day.
verses.ct: Joshua burned Ai to the ground, turning it into a permanent ruin — a wasteland that remains to this day.

verses.kjv: And the king of Ai he hanged on a tree until eventide: and as soon as the sun was down, Joshua commanded that they should take his carcase down from the tree, and cast it at the entering of the gate of the city, and raise thereon a great heap of stones, that remaineth unto this day.
verses.ct: He hung the king of Ai on a tree and left him there until evening. At sunset, Joshua ordered them to take the body down from the tree and throw it at the entrance of the city gate. They piled a large mound of stones over it, which is still there today.

verses.kjv: Then Joshua built an altar unto the LORD God of Israel in mount Ebal,
verses.ct: Then Joshua built an altar to the LORD, the God of Israel, on Mount Ebal.

verses.kjv: As Moses the servant of the LORD commanded the children of Israel, as it is written in the book of the law of Moses, an altar of whole stones, over which no man hath lift up any iron: and they offered thereon burnt offerings unto the LORD, and sacrificed peace offerings.
verses.ct: He built it just as Moses, the servant of the LORD, had commanded the people of Israel — as recorded in the book of the law of Moses — an altar of uncut stones that no iron tool had touched. On it they presented burnt offerings to the LORD and sacrificed peace offerings.

verses.kjv: And he wrote there upon the stones a copy of the law of Moses, which he wrote in the presence of the children of Israel.
verses.ct: There, on the stones, Joshua inscribed a copy of the law of Moses while the people of Israel watched.

verses.kjv: And all Israel, and their elders, and officers, and their judges, stood on this side the ark and on that side before the priests the Levites, which bare the ark of the covenant of the LORD, as well the stranger, as he that was born among them; half of them over against mount Gerizim, and half of them over against mount Ebal; as Moses the servant of the LORD had commanded before, that they should bless the people of Israel.
verses.ct: All of Israel — their elders, officials, and judges — stood on both sides of the ark, facing the Levitical priests who carried the ark of the covenant of the LORD. Both foreigners and native-born Israelites were present. Half of them stood in front of Mount Gerizim and half in front of Mount Ebal, just as Moses the servant of the LORD had previously commanded for the blessing of the people of Israel.

verses.kjv: And afterward he read all the words of the law, the blessings and cursings, according to all that is written in the book of the law.
verses.ct: After that, Joshua read aloud every word of the law — both the blessings and the curses — exactly as written in the book of the law.

verses.kjv: There was not a word of all that Moses commanded, which Joshua read not before all the congregation of Israel, with the women, and the little ones, and the strangers that were conversant among them.
verses.ct: There was not a single word of everything Moses had commanded that Joshua failed to read aloud to the entire assembly of Israel, including the women, the children, and the foreigners living among them.
